div.title: Welcome to the Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences @ UC Irvine

blockquote.div:
André
van der Hoek
Few disciplines have changed as rapidly or have had as much impact as Computer Science. This change and impact are what make the field so much fun. Change, though, presents challenges for researchers, teachers and students.
What was a key topic for study and classroom discussion in the 1970s or 1980s is not necessarily - nor very likely - to be so key in the 21st century. New topics emerge continuously that require prominent positions in curricula, yet we cannot forget the foundations and knowledge that have stood the test of time.
With the opportunities for software and computer based applications exploding before us, the Department of Informatics was formed to provide a focus for study and research in software and information systems design.
Targeting this particular segment of the burgeoning computer science landscape, our fourteen collegial faculty members are engaged in exciting research projects, launching a new undergraduate curriculum, and mentoring the finest Ph.D students in the nation.
We hope you find this Web site effective in answering your questions about us, our work and especially about the many ways to become a part of this field - perhaps as an undergraduate in our new major, as a graduate student or as a scientific research partner.
Welcome to Informatics at UCI!
André van der Hoek
Professor and Chair
Department of Informatics
